metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6349 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow at a u_read_undo memory allocation site would occur forvim before patch 8.0.0377, if it does not properly validate values for treelength when reading a corrupted undo file, which may lead to resultantbuffer overflows.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6349` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.4').
